speaker: Zach
text: [_on tape_] Janet from North Seattle, you're in bed with Dr. Zach.  How can I make you feel better?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah... [_laughs_]

speaker: Janet
text: [_on tape_] My husband isn't the man he used to be, if you know what I mean.  It's ruining our marriage.

speaker: Zach
text: Are you sure it's just his fault?  The signs on "Love Street" don't all point one way.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, this is the competition?  Dr. Zach?  Please!  It's nothing but suggestive, smarmy sleaze.

speaker: Roz
text: And he's great at it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!  You know what, I tell you what, I give this guy four, five weeks, tops.

speaker: Kenny
text: He's been on the air ten weeks.  And frankly, we're getting spanked.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, he did a whole show on that yesterday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!  So, well... all right, he's the new flavor of the month.  We've seen them come and go before.  Dr. Mary, Professor Hugs, "On the Couch With Jeff and Lars."

speaker: Kenny
text: I don't know, Doc, I think this guy's got staying power.

speaker: Roz
text: He did a whole show on that Tuesday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cut it out, Roz!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, you know, maybe we should try some of those theme shows.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, actually we have done theme shows.  You know, I still get letters about the show we did on existential angst!

speaker: Roz
text: No, we don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: I get them at home.

speaker: Kenny
text: You know, I'm just saying it wouldn't hurt to spice things up a little.  You know, mention people's privates once in a while.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, absolutely not.  My show is fine the way it is.  What it needs is a little more support from this station.  How about some advertising?

speaker: Kenny
text: Whoa, whoa, I don't want to just throw money at the problem.

speaker: Roz
text: Thirty seconds, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right.  Well, then how about airing some more promos on my lead-in?  I mean, they get a sizable audience.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, they do.  That's why we're moving them to evening drive time.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean I'm their lead-in now?

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah.  They're not too happy about it.

speaker: Roz
text: [_on air_] And we're back, the final hour of the Frasier Crane Show.  Our next caller is Garth from Mercer Island.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, Garth.  I'm listening.

speaker: Garth
text: [_v.o._] See, this is kind of weird talking about to a psychiatrist, but it is something couples go through, and since I'm not using my real name, maybe it's okay.

speaker: Garth
text: It's... our household budget. _Kenny leaves in exasperation, as Frasier and Roz sag with disappointment.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment Martin and Niles are sat eating breakfast.  Daphne brings some coffee from the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: Any more sausage, Daph?

speaker: Daphne
text: I told you five links ago, you're cut off.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on!  I'm being good, I took my cholesterol pill.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, and that was the last one.  You'd better call Dr. Stewart.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he'll make me go through a whole physical just to get a refill.  Hey, Niles, couldn't you write me a prescription?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I can't, Dad, sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Why not?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't have your chart, I'm not familiar with your medical history-

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, you see me every day, you know I'm fine.  Just get your little pad out and write "more pills."

speaker: Niles
text: What's the big deal?  Why do you hate going to the doctor so much?

speaker: Martin
text: Everybody does.

speaker: Daphne
text: Not my brother Billy.  He loved going to the doctors.  From the time he was a little boy he'd start getting undressed in the car.  And mind you, that was just for the dentist.  As he got older, he volunteered for medical studies, supported himself getting all sorts of experimental drugs pumped into him. [_goes into the kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Think she's finished?

speaker: Niles
text: Wait for it.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_comes back with a rack of danishes_] One year, he grew little boobies!

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, there.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, good morning, all. [_sees the paper_] Dear God.  Do you believe this?  A full-page ad!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_reading_] "Cuddle Up With Dr. Zach."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  As if some air-brushed picture of a pretty boy has anything to do with effective therapy!

speaker: Daphne
text: He is awfully cute.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking_] Yet not so much you hate him for it.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right!  You know, that's the reason I keep losing to him in the ratings.  His station keeps flooding the marketplace with this useless tripe!  It's my turn now.  I'm going to call my agent.  Let her earn her ten percent.  Tell you what, once Bebe gets through with the station, my face will be splattered all over this city! [_picks up the phone and takes the paper to the couch_]

speaker: Daphne
text: That Bebe is a monster, I don't know why you chose her.

speaker: Niles
text: What possessed you?  Yeah, right - she did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Bebe's evil, but she's my evil. [_takes a pen and starts marking the paper_]

speaker: Martin
text: Better bring a newborn baby in case she gets hungry.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, all this over a picture in the paper, it seems a little petty.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not petty.  It's about getting my due as a respected member of this community, and as a titan of Seattle radio psychiatry! [_finishes marking the paper and laughs_] Ha-ha! Yeah, you're not so pretty with a mustache and a hairy mole now, are ya? _He proudly holds up the paper, showing off his embellishments.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Bebe's Office Frasier is sitting in Bebe's waiting room, while her secretary shuffles around in the background.  Bebe comes out._

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier Crane!  I wish my eyes were sore so you could be a sight for them!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_kisses her cheeks_] Thank you, Bebe, thank you for seeing me on such short notice.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, there's no such thing as short notice for my favorite client! [_to her secretary_] Get Dr. Crane some coffee, please.

speaker: Bebe
text: So, how may I serve you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, actually KACL is not doing all it should to promote my show.

speaker: Bebe
text: Say no more.  We'll put the fear of God into them.  We'll hold their feet to the fire until their skin crackles!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Bebe, I knew I could count on you.

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, it won't be me personally.  I think now is the time to unleash the newest member of Team Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, you've become too big to be served by the efforts of one adoring mortal.  That's why I'm bringing on more firepower!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I like the sound of that!

speaker: Bebe
text: I thought you might!  Frasier, meet your new agent, Portia Sanders. _Frasier turns around - and sees Bebe's secretary standing there. Where Bebe is dark, pushy, and brassy, Portia is blonde, wispy, and squeaky-voiced.  Frasier cannot believe it._

speaker: Portia
text: Pleased to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes her hand_] We've met.  Several hundred times. [_to Bebe_] This is your assistant.

speaker: Bebe
text: Not anymore.  Now she's a full-fledged junior agent.

speaker: Frasier
text: She brings me coffee. [_takes the cup she's brought_]

speaker: Bebe
text: She'll bring you Juan Valdez on a donkey if that's what you want!

speaker: Portia
text: I thought we should start by scheduling a meeting to get more acquainted.

speaker: Frasier
text: We've met!

speaker: Portia
text: You've only met Portia the assistant, the girl who's spent the last four years answering phones and getting your coffee just right.  Well, Portia the agent plans to take that same attention to detail when representing you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, but you've never gotten my coffee right. [_hands it back_]

speaker: Portia
text: You never said anything before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I have, every time.

speaker: Bebe
text: Portia, will you give us a minute?

speaker: Portia
text: Is this about me?  Because I would love the opportunity to address any concerns.

speaker: Bebe
text: Just go outside.

speaker: Portia
text: I'll be outside if you need me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, that's good to know.

speaker: Bebe
text: Seems innocent, doesn't she?  Almost naive.  That's the quality that sets the trap.  Then, when she's lulled her prey, she pounces, pounces like a tiger-

speaker: Frasier
text: All right!  Bebe, what's going on here?  Are you fobbing me off?

speaker: Bebe
text: Ouch!  Do you want the knife back, or shall I just keep it in my heart?  Portia will merely be looking after the day-to-day details, freeing me up for the big picture.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Bebe
text: Of course.  You are the rock upon which this agency is founded, upon which we continue to thrive!

speaker: Zach
text: Oh, sorry to interrupt, Bebe, but we have reservations at one o'clock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Zach!  What is he doing here?

speaker: Bebe
text: Dr. Who?  I'm confused, who are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, Bebe!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_pushes Dr. Zach out_] You were supposed to meet me in the restaurant - whoever you are! [_closes the door_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, how could you?  I feel so betrayed.

speaker: Bebe
text: And I am just as outraged as you are!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I see what's going on here.  You're trying to pass me off to your assistant so that you can devote all  your attention to your new number one client!

speaker: Bebe
text: Nonsense.  There is no one more important to me than you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then let him have the junior agent.

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier... we have done great things, you and I.  We've climbed this mountain together and planted your flag. Now I've discovered another young man who... wants to plant his flag.  Would you deny me the chance to share in that adventure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, come on, don't be selfish!  You'll be fine with Portia. Don't forget, she reports directly to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe... throughout our relationship, I have put up with a lot. But I never doubted for an instant your devotion to my career. Apparently, that is at an end.  And so, therefore, is my association with this agency. [_goes to the door_] And, screw, may I add, YOU!

speaker: Portia
text: I was thinking we could have that meeting next Tuesday.

speaker: Frasier
text: We have met! [_leaves_] _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **IN MARTIN'S DEFENSE, EDDIE ATE SOME TOO** _Scene Four - Apartment Frasier comes in the door.  Martin is in his chair, Niles and Daphne are pouring sherries by the bar.  On the table is a pot of flowers._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.  You just missed your new agent.  She sent those. [_points to the flowers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't miss her.  I was hiding in the stairwell until she left.  And Portia is not my new agent.  She's Bebe's minion! Her little winged monkey!  The woman has been hounding me - you know, I had to turn off my cell phone.  God only knows how she got the new number.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, did the woman from the Publisher's Clearing House reach you?  She seemed quite insistent.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, she sounds like a real go-getter.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't care if she is, it'll be a cold day in hell before I go back to Bebe's agency.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, uh, you're not going to send back the flowers and muffins, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't see any muffins.

speaker: Martin
text: I mean, if she had sent muffins.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, Dad, there will be muffins a-plenty.  Now that I am agent-less, the word will spread like wildfire!  You be prepared for this phone to start ringing right off the hook! _Everyone glances expectantly at the phone, Martin cupping a hand to his ear._

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't mean literally.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know, but how great would that have been?  You saying, "phone's gonna start ringing," and boom!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, yes.  The truth is, I'm excited.  I'm excited about having a new agent, I'm excited about being excited about my career again!

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, so close! [_Niles tries to take away her sherry, but she waves him off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: And so it begins.  The sharks smell Crane in the water.  Let's just see which one of them's hungriest, shall we? [_picks up_] Hello?  Yes, could you hold on for just one moment, please? [_holds out the phone_] It's for you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Oh, hi, Dr. Stewart, thanks for calling me back. Um, I was hoping you could refill my prescription without me coming into the office.  Oh, come on, doc!  My son's a doctor, he says I look fine. [_smaller voice_] A psychiatrist.  Okay, okay, I'll be in there tomorrow.  Bye. [_hangs up; to Niles_] I hope you're satisfied.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad, we've discussed this.  I'm happy to drive you to the doctor, but I can't just write you a prescription.  I would never violate my ethics like that.  Have you asked Frasier?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he said the same old baloney you do.  Look, I've been taking this medicine for four years, Niles.  I don't need an exam, I just need a refill.

speaker: Niles
text: No!

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's a thought: Niles, you're a doctor.  Why don't you give your father a full medical examination?  That way you'll both be satisfied.

speaker: Martin
text: Can you pick me up at one?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah. _Martin does a hasty about-turn and heads for the hallway, while Niles gulps down the rest of his sherry.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - KACL Roz is sat in her booth as usual.  Frasier's voice is on the air, but his booth is empty.  Portia enters Roz's booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on air_] I'm telling you that most problems are resolved...

speaker: Portia
text: Knock, knock.  I'm looking for Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, he's not working today.

speaker: Portia
text: Then why am I hearing his show?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, we play "The Best of Crane" on Wednesdays.

speaker: Portia
text: Oh.  Well, would you please ask him to call Portia?  It's really important. [_gives Roz her card_]

speaker: Roz
text: Sure. _Portia leaves.  Roz knocks on the glass partition, and Frasier emerges from under the console, still holding the mike._

speaker: Frasier
text: And I know it's never easy, Rachel, but you and your husband won't get anywhere until you confront your problems head-on. [_disconnects_] We'll be right back, Seattle, after the news.

speaker: Roz
text: Can't dodge her forever.

speaker: Frasier
text: I won't have to, Roz, as soon as I have a new agent.  Have there been any calls?

speaker: Roz
text: Nope, sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  What the hell is going on?  Surely someone would be interested in representing me.  I still have a viable career, even if, arguably, it may or may not be going through what might be perceived by some as a... tiny lull.

speaker: Portia
text: [_re-enters_] There you are! [_Frasier turns and gasps_] I was leaving you a note on the windshield of your car, and I said to myself, "His car's here, so he's here, so why am I leaving a note on his windshield?" [_giggles, and hands him the note_] Here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Portia, I'm sure you're a lovely person, and I applaud your effort to find a new career - but not at the expense of my own.

speaker: Portia
text: But you haven't heard my ideas yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nor will I. [_hands back the note_] How can I make this any clearer to you?  You are not my agent.  You're not going to be my agent.  Not now, not ever.  So go practice on someone else's time, and leave me alone.

speaker: Roz
text: That was brutal.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sighs_] Don't worry, Roz, I'll be okay.

speaker: Roz
text: She seems very persistent.  That's not such a horrible thing to have in an agent.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd rather have no agent at all, than let Bebe win! [_thinks_] You know, that's not such a bad idea.  I don't need an agent, I can represent myself!  I mean, I have some insight into the human mind.  I think that would be helpful in negotiations. My God, I should have thought of this sooner!  Just think of the money I could save!

speaker: Roz
text: Isn't that what you said when you cut your own hair?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  That was just an emotional response to an unruly cowlick.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, fine.  So, you represent Frasier Crane.  Now what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, for one, I'll do what Bebe couldn't do: I'll get Kenny to boost the advertising budget for our show. [_knocks on the glass_]

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, but you already asked him that and he said no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that was Dr. Frasier Crane asking.  Now, it's Agent Crane - licensed to charm.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_enters_] What is it, Doc?  Is this about promos?

speaker: Frasier
text: No! [_laughs, to Roz_] Will you believe this guy?  No, Kenny, listen, I've been thinking.  You know, I think it's high time that you and I got together outside of the workplace.  So, there's a little club downtown that I go to.  How would you like to join me tomorrow for a little... uh, a little massage, and a little steam, huh?  What do you say?

speaker: Kenny
text: Are you kidding?  I'm front and center with a fistful of singles!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taken aback, laughs_] Kenny, hah!  It-it's not that kind of club.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh... fives?

speaker: Roz
text: What is wrong with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's an athletic club, with squash courts and a swimming pool.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, right! [_confidential whisper_] Gotcha. [_leaves_]  FADE TO:  Scene Six - Niles's Mercedes Niles is driving Martin to the doctor's. _

speaker: Martin
text: Hmm, I'm sure you're happy.  You're not gonna be spending the next hour sitting bare-assed on some cold steel table.

speaker: Niles
text: And neither are you, you big baby.  I'm sorry, I'd help if I could, Dad, but I swore an oath.

speaker: Niles
text: I wonder what this is about. [_pulls over_] I'm sure it's just a misunderstanding.

speaker: Niles
text: Good afternoon, officer.  Uh, I didn't do anything wrong, did I?

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, son, you made an illegal left turn back there.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Dad.

speaker: Cop
text: License and registration, please.

speaker: Niles
text: [_as he's fishing them out_] Uh, you know, officer, my father here is no stranger to the rules of the road.  Isn't that right, Dad?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, sir, he is, uh, intimately acquainted with Lady Law. Aren't you, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Just a concerned citizen.

speaker: Cop
text: I'll be right back. [_walks back to his car_]

speaker: Niles
text: Why didn't you flash your badge and get me out of the ticket?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I would have, Niles, but I took an oath too.  However, if you were to take out that prescription pad...

speaker: Niles
text: Are you blackmailing your own son?

speaker: Martin
text: I'd write fast, there's nothing I can do once he writes that ticket. _Niles hurriedly takes out his pad and scribbles on it.  Martin leans out his window._

speaker: Martin
text: Officer? _As the cop comes back, Niles tears off the slip.  Martin tucks it inside his jacket._

speaker: Cop
text: Yes?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, yeah, officer, I was wondering if maybe you could give my son a break. [_flashes his badge_] I don't think he'll be doing that again.

speaker: Cop
text: Well, uh, I guess this time I could let it slide. [_rips off the ticket and gives it to Niles_] Drive carefully.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I will.  Thank you, sir.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: I got news for you: you didn't make an illegal left turn. That's a buddy of mine.  I set the whole thing up to get you to write me my prescription! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_fastens his seat belt_] I got news for you: I just drew you a picture of a dog. _Martin stops laughing, checks the slip, and sees HE'S the one who's been had._

speaker: Niles
text: [_starts the car again_] R-R-Ruff! _FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Locker Room The empty locker room at Frasier's upscale health club.  There are two rows of lockers along opposite walls, and two benches.  Frasier and Kenny, wearing only towels, exit the steam room._  [__N.B. Check out Kelsey Grammer's performance in the 1998 HBO comedy, "The Pentagon Wars" for more Turkish bath humor.__]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, what'd you think?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, I could get addicted to that!  What was that stuff?

speaker: Frasier
text: Steam!

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, it felt so great!  Everything's great here!  I can't believe I never heard of this place. [_sits on a bench_] They should advertise or something.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sits opposite him_] You know, speaking of advertising, I think our recent dip in the ratings is due to a lack of advertising.

speaker: Kenny
text: What's to advertise, Doc?  Your show's nine years old.  Unless there's some new angle to promote, it's money better spent elsewhere.  Now if you'll excuse me, I noticed a basket of free combs by the sink. _Kenny leaves.  Frasier throws down his small towel in frustration, then turns and opens his locker.  Behind him, Portia walks into the locker room.  Just as Frasier unwraps his towel from his waist-_

speaker: Portia
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gasps, jerks his towel back on_] Portia, what the hell are you doing here?  This is a private club and a men's locker room, get out!

speaker: Portia
text: Not until you give me a chance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I told you, I'm not interested.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Doc, can I borrow your roll-on?  I left mine at home- [_unwraps his towel, turning around_] HEY! _He fumbles his towel, dropping it to the floor, and shields himself with the locker door._

speaker: Portia
text: You must be Kenny Daly.  I'm Portia Sanders, Frasier's agent.

speaker: Frasier
text: She is not my agent!

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm naked.

speaker: Portia
text: How much are you prepared to increase this man's advertising budget?

speaker: Kenny
text: Zero, and again, naked.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hands him his towel_] Kenny, look, I apologize for this. Portia, you're leaving!

speaker: Portia
text: Not until he hears me out.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_grabs his pants_] Well, forget it, I'm out of here. [_Portia snatches them away_] Hey!  What are you doing?

speaker: Portia
text: Taking your pants.  You'll get them back when I'm finished. Okay, you're saving a few bucks on advertising, but with a little investment now, you can make a bundle when we syndicate!

speaker: Kenny
text: Are you kidding?  Who's gonna want to syndicate Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey!

speaker: Kenny
text: No, no, no offense, Doc, but if you were to syndicate-

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, I take offense! [_they start arguing_]

speaker: Portia
text: [_Bebe-ish_] All right!  Sit down, and listen up! _Surprised, they shut up.  Kenny bumps into the locker and rewraps his towel.  He and Frasier sit on a bench together._

speaker: Portia
text: Legs together! [_N.B. Kudos to Chenoweth :-)_] _Portia transforms before their eyes - the hypnotic pitch, the expansive gestures, the haunted eyes - leaving us no doubt whose prot�g�e she really is.  She drapes Kenny's pants over her shoulder and begins._

speaker: Portia
text: All right, maybe you two don't see the potential for syndication... but I do.  Sure, the big markets are harder to crack.  But we'll start smaller - KBCD in Medford, KBAB in Boise.  They're both changing their formats.  After the beginning of the year, they're going to need new programming. Soon, we'll have a vast and viable audience. [_gestures with the pants_] Oh, think of it!  The obsessive-compulsive on his tractor... the bipolar cop on his beat... the soccer mom seething with rage! [_points to Frasier_] And they're all out there across this great land of yours, just waiting for you to help them!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enraptured_] I've always thought that!

speaker: Portia
text: Yes! [_to Kenny_] But I can't do any of this unless you start backing us up with some advertising! [_to Frasier_] And you! You've got to be ready to schmooze every station manager from Portland, to the other Portland! [_steps back_] I'm hungry for this.  I need you both to be as hungry as I am!  Are you hungry?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_jumps up_] I'm starving!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_jumps up_] Me, too!

speaker: Portia
text: [_normal voice_] Great.  Call my office Monday morning, we'll go over the details. _She walks out, still carrying the pants, leaving Frasier and Kenny awestruck._

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow!  That was my very first locker room pep talk!

speaker: Kenny
text: Mine, too!

speaker: Frasier
text: She took your pants, you know!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_laughing_] I know! _The realization slowly hits Kenny, but Frasier still trembles with excitement.  END OF ACT TWO_
